current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To clarify that any private flood insurance policy accepted by a State shall satisfy the mandatory
			 purchase requirement under the Flood Disaster Protection Act of 1973.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Flood Insurance Market Parity and Modernization Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Flood Insurance Market Parity and Modernization Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended to read as follows:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Paragraph (7) of section 102(b) of the Flood Disaster Protection Act of
			 1973

header.#text:
Authority of States to
			 regulate private flood insurance

text.#text: is issued by an insurance company that is—

licensed, admitted, or otherwise approved to engage in the business of insurance in the State or
			 jurisdiction in which the insured building is located, by the insurance
			 regulator of that State or jurisdiction; or

eligible as a nonadmitted insurer to provide insurance in the State or jurisdiction where the
			 property to be insured is located, in accordance with

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
sections 521 through
			 527 of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act/s:521..527

text.#text:
is issued by an insurance company that is not otherwise disapproved as a surplus lines insurer by
			 the insurance regulator of the State or jurisdiction where the property to
			 be insured is located.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S2381 IS: Flood Insurance Market Parity and Modernization Act of 2014

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}rights.#text: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
